comment._content:

comment.author: 11778912@N06
comment._content: I believe the time frame for this photo is wrong. Valcartier Camp wasn't set up until the beginning of WW1, after August 1914.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: tinhutjohn, you're right -- these photos are from the Bain Photo Agency's 1914 photostream. I don't know why LOC insists on confusing people with those incorrect dates at the beginning of every Flickr photo entry. I wish they would cut it out.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: To be more precise than the ballpark estimated dates, "approximately 1910-1915," we're still relying on help from people like yourselves who can confirm the subject matter or have time to decipher the mirror-image dates!   -- Helena

comment.author: 70251312@N00
35607158@N06
comment._content: The principal's full name is Col. Victor Williams, former Adjutant-General of the Militia. Later in the war he was a Brig.-Gen. commanding the 8th Infantry Brigade and was captured in action.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: jamica1:  Thanks for the full name of Col. Victor Williams.  We will add it to the image description when we update.
